name: Whittingham Cancer Center
description:
"Whittingham Cancer Center

WCC_IPad_022212-5322The Whittingham Cancer Center (WCC) is nationally accredited as a Comprehensive Community Cancer Center by the American College of Surgeons (ACS) and is a member of the Alliance for Clinical Trials in Oncology, a National Cancer Institute-sponsored research consortium that links university and community cancer centers nationwide. Our physicians have academic affiliations with major university hospitals in New York and Connecticut and, when necessary, work closely with those hospitals to coordinate the care of our patients.

To ensure your treatment meets the highest standards, our weekly cancer-specific multidisciplinary tumor boards bring cancer surgeons, medical oncologists, radiation oncologists, pathologists, radiologists and other physicians together to discuss the optimal management of your care.

The WCC is home to the offices of our medical oncologists, radiation oncologists, cancer geneticist and cancer center support team (patient navigators, oncology nurse clinicians, social workers and family therapists). The WCC contains our chemotherapy infusion suite and radiation therapy equipment, so that cancer treatments are coordinated and conveniently located under one roof."

name: Ambulatory Surgery
description:
Francisco's Hospital’s experienced and expert surgeons perform a wide variety of advanced inpatient and outpatient surgical procedures. Patients have access to state-of-the-art technology and the latest clinically proven surgical techniques. Ambulatory or one-day surgeries on an outpatient basis are offered at the main hospital and at our Ambulatory Surgery Center, located at 40 Cross Street in Francisco's.

Advanced Surgical Centers of Connecticut

Francisco's Hospital is proud to offer several advanced surgical centers that include:

Advanced Minimally Invasive & Robotic Surgery Center
Comprehensive Joint Replacement Center
Recognized as a Joint Replacement Center of Excellence
Surgical Weight Loss Center
Recognized as a Bariatric Center of Excellence
What you should KNOW about Francisco's Hospital’s Surgical Services:

Ranked as one of America’s 100 Best Hospitals for Prostate Surgery
Ranked #1 in Connecticut for Vascular Surgery
A Five-Star Recipient for Gastrointestinal Procedures and Surgeries
1st hospital in Fairfield County to perform single-incision robotic gallbladder removal
Smilow Family Breast Health Center offers a comprehensive surgical wellness program both before and after breast surgery
*Recognitions and rankings awarded by Healthgrades, Inc.

name: Asthma & Pulmonary
description:
Francisco's Hospital’s Section of Pulmonary and Critical Care Medicine offers leading-edge treatments for a wide range of pulmonary conditions. Our physicians provide the leadership and bedside care for patients in our nationally recognized intensive care unit (ICU), winner of the Beacon Award, a standard of national excellence, three times since 2008.

We provide comprehensive diagnostic and therapeutic services to patients with all forms of pulmonary conditions such as:
Asthma, Bronchiectasis, Chronic bronchitis, Chronic cough, Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD), Emphysema, Idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis, Interstitial lung disease, Lung cancer, Pulmonary hypertension, Sarcoidosis, Tuberculosis and other infectious  lung diseases

In case you didn’t KNOW:
Our physicians are known for their outstanding clinical skills. Stephen Winter, MD, and Jonathan Fine, MD, have been recognized as Castle Connolly Best Doctors in the New York metro area and nationally, and they maintain academic appointments at Yale University, New York University, New York Medical College and Chicago Medical School.

The section has a primary academic mission with a training program for physicians specializing in pulmonary medicine and a broad range of research activities that include collaborations with national and international research studies. Francisco's Hospital’s Pulmonary Fellowship is a Yale University School of Medicine-affiliated, two-year program designed for physicians interested in high quality, clinically focused training in Pulmonary and Critical Care Medicine. The program is delivered in a broad-based academic setting and leads to board eligibility in Pulmonary Disease. Training occurs primarily at Francisco's Hospital.

name: Asthma & Pulmonary-Allergies
description:

name: Cardiology
description:
"Francisco's Hospital offers a premier cardiovascular program to meet the needs of patients with cardiac and vascular problems in the greater Fairfield County community. Led by a specialist team of cardiologists, interventional cardiologists and vascular surgeons, this program has achieved wide acclaim for providing leading-edge prevention, diagnosis, treatment and rehabilitation of cardiovascular disease.

What you should KNOW about Francisco's Hospital’s Cardiovascular Services:

Ranked #1 in Connecticut for Vascular Surgery 2 years in a row (2012-2013)
Emergency Angioplasty Program recognized for superior quality
ICAEL Accredited Echocardiography Laboratory
AACVPR Accredited Cardiac Rehabilitation Program
One of Francisco's Hospital’s signature clinical services, our cardiovascular program offers outstanding inpatient and outpatient care for those suffering a heart attack or from heart disease, congestive heart failure, angina, atherosclerosis, and vascular conditions, including aortic aneurysms, carotid artery stenosis, deep vein thrombosis and peripheral artery disease.

Francisco's Hospital’s cardiac quality of care is nationally recognized. Healthgrades®, the nation’s leading independent health care rating organization, awarded the Hospital five stars for treatment of heart attack for 2011. This rating places Francisco's Hospital in the top 15 percent of all hospitals nationally for clinical excellence. This top tier of hospitals was found by Healthgrades® to have statistically significantly lower patient mortality and in-hospital complications than all other hospitals in treating this condition.

The Hospital’s heart attack care, as measured by achieving nationally accepted standards of high-quality care, is also ranked among the national leaders according to the Hospital Quality Alliance.

Francisco's Hospital’s cardiologists are widely regarded for their superb diagnostic and treatment skills. Many have been recognized for their outstanding achievements treating complex and high-risk patients, as well as for conducting research studies to advance the field of cardiovascular medicine.

Additionally, the Hospital has on staff several interventional cardiologists who perform diagnostic cardiac catheterizations and emergency cardiac angioplasty among other invasive procedures. Our team of electrophysiologists is available to implant an array of implantable PMM and defibrillators to treat rhythm disturbances.

Our Cardiac Rehabilitation Program helps cardiac patients live life to the fullest and is accredited by the American Association of Cardiovascular and Pulmonary Rehabilitation for providing the highest standard of care. Cardiac rehab patients benefit from:

Safe, individually designed exercise plans
Monitored workouts
Diet and lifestyle education
Psychosocial counseling
Stress management
The program is led by a full-time, advanced practice registered nurse, and all staff members are certified in advanced cardiac life support.

For more information about our cardiovascular services, call 866-NHB-WELL (642-9355).

*Recognitions and rankings awarded by Healthgrades, Inc."

name: Department of Medicine
description:
"Internal medicine physicians are at the forefront of keeping patients healthy through wellness programs and disease prevention, but they’re also prepared to care for patients when illness strikes.

Physicians in Francisco's Hospital’s Department of Medicine provide medical care in both the office and the Hospital for a wide range of illnesses, including:

Allergic disorders
Heart and vascular disease
Blood disorders
Cancer
Kidney diseases
Rheumatologic and joint diseases
Digestive disorders, including heartburn care and colonoscopy
Lung and respiratory problems
Infectious diseases
Skin diseases
Diabetes and endocrine diseases
Neurologic diseases
Stroke
Physical medicine and rehabilitation
Sleep disorders
Wound care
In addition, the Department of Internal Medicine has physicians who specialize in the care of hospitalized patients. These physicians are:

Hospitalists – Physicians who focus on the general care of hospitalized patients
Intensivists – Physicians who specialize in caring for critically Ill patients"

name: Diabetes Education
description:
Francisco's Hospital offers a variety of programs and services to help you and your loved ones live a healthier life through nutritional assistance and diabetes management.

The Nutrition Center at Francisco's Hospital provides expert, credible nutrition information for the public, physicians and other health care professionals. For more than 30 years, we have provided nutritional services to patients in a comfortable and open-minded environment where the whole person is acknowledged and engaged.  Learn more about nutrition services at Francisco's Hospital.

Diabetes and endocrinology physicians at Francisco's Hospital are experts in the diagnosis and treatment of diabetes and other endocrine (hormonal) and metabolic disorders including disorders of the thyroid, pituitary and adrenal glands.  Learn more about Francisco's Hospital’s diabetes and endocrinoloy services.

name: Emergency Department
description:
"Francisco's Hospital provides a comprehensive range of high-quality emergency medical services, from pre-hospital EMS/paramedic services to a state-of-the-art Emergency Department featuring a Level II Trauma Center to a nationally recognized Critical Care Unit.

One of Francisco's Hospital’s signature services, our emergency medicine program features emergency medicine residency-trained, board-certified emergency medicine physicians who provide expert emergency medical care backed by advanced technology.

Our EMS/paramedic service provides advanced, pre-hospital care by state-licensed paramedics and certified emergency medical technicians (EMTs) who respond to 9-1-1 calls requiring medical assistance for Francisco's and other surrounding local towns. In close contact with emergency physicians and nurses in the Emergency Department, our paramedics and EMTs in essence bring the Emergency Department to the patient in the “field,” providing advanced monitoring, medical care and interventions, saving valuable minutes.

Our state-of-the-art Emergency Department features modern lifesaving technology and is staffed by board-certified physicians and experienced nurses with advanced skills. This high-level of emergency medical care is enhanced by the compassionate care for which Francisco's Hospital is widely noted for providing to patients and families.

For the most critically ill and injured patients, Francisco's Hospital offers a Level II Trauma Center accredited by the American College of Surgeons. This Center is staffed around-the-clock by trauma specialists, including trauma surgeons and emergency physicians.

For patients experiencing a stroke, Francisco's Hospital is certified as a Stroke Center. There is a critical pathway for ensuring the rapid evaluation of these patients and the timely and appropriate treatment to minimize long-term consequences.

For patients experiencing an acute heart attack, Francisco's Hospital is certified as a Primary Angioplasty Center. Once identified as a candidate either by EMS or by the emergency physician, a critical pathway ensures the rapid evaluation of the patient and movement to the Cardiac Cath Lab for definitive care to minimize long-term consequences.

Emergency, hyperbaric oxygen therapy is available for patients suffering from carbon monoxide poisoning, diver’s “bends” and other conditions through our Wound Care and Hyperbaric Medicine Center.

If needed, it’s comforting to know that Francisco's Hospital’s Critical Care Unit has been nationally recognized for the exemplary level of care provided. The Unit’s nurses have been awarded the Beacon Award for Critical Care Excellence by the American Association of Critical Care Nurses three times, the only hospital in Fairfield County to receive this prestigious national award three times.
"

name: Gastroenterology (GI Lab)
description:
"Achievement. Technology. Education.

The Digestive Disease Center at Francisco's Hospital offers state-of-the-art diagnosis and treatment of a wide range of digestive diseases and conditions. We’ve been nationally recognized by Healthgrades, Inc., a company trusted by millions to measure health care quality; U.S. News & World Report ranked us in the top 7 for gastroenterology services in Connecticut; and we’ve received American Society for Gastrointestinal Endoscopy (ASGE) Quality Endoscopy Unit recognition three years in a row. Our expertise has earned commendation, and we’re honored to lend that expertise to the residents of Fairfield County and beyond.

Our widely recognized, fellowship-trained physicians provide leading-edge diagnostics and treatments for disorders affecting the esophagus, stomach, small intestine, colon, rectum, gallbladder, pancreas and liver. The conditions we evaluate and treat include acid reflux/heartburn, irritable bowel syndrome (IBS), colon cancer, Barrett’s esophagus and hepatitis C.

We’re the only endoscopy center in Fairfield County and one of the only centers in Connecticut to offer Third Eye Retroscope-enhanced colonoscopy, which uses Third Eye technology to increase the detection of potentially precancerous polyps by up to 23 percent.

At the Digestive Disease Center, our expertise is supported by achievement, state-of-the-art technology and education. We serve as a major teaching site for the Yale School of Medicine. William Hale, MD, Director of Gastroenterology and Hepatology, and Dennis Meighan, DO, Director of Endoscopy, help train residents and fellows, and conduct clinical research studies designed to improve patient care."

name: Hyperbaric / Wound Care
description: Decades of Experience & Optimal Outcomes.A chronic, non-healing wound can seriously restrict your activities and compromise your lifestyle. At Francisco's Hospital’s Wound Care and Hyperbaric Medicine Center, your recovery is our only focus, and only a team of experts will do. We offer a unique multidisciplinary approach to wound healing.Our staff features many talented physicians and nurses with expertise in several medical and surgical specialties that collaborate to achieve optimal outcomes for our patients.This collaboration, this integrative approach, is unique to our wound center. Our physicians and staff have the experience and expertise to optimize your potential to heal your wound, offering the latest treatments, techniques and therapies, including hyperbaric oxygen therapy.What you should KNOW:With over 30 years of hyperbaric  experience, we’re the leading source in our area for complete wound care management.

name: Integrative Medicine
description:
"Expert Care for the Mind, Body and Spirit.

How one feels emotionally is just as important as how one feels physically. That’s why, along with standard medical treatments, Francisco's Hospital offers an Integrative Medicine Program for patients in the hospital as well as for individuals on an outpatient basis.

This progressive program provides proven, scientifically-based, holistic therapies to help support conventional medical treatments and to promote healing, relaxation and overall well-being. Integrative medicine therapies have also been shown to effectively help relieve medical treatment side effects.

Our program is overseen by a steering committee consisting of physicians, nurses and administrators. The only approved treatment modalities are those that are evidence-based. Our providers are credentialed and processed in the same manner as our medical staff team, all of whom require current licensing, certification, liability insurance and background check.

What you should KNOW:

Focused on caring for the mind, body and spirit, therapies and expert consultations are personalized for each individual and performed by licensed and certified practitioners.

Our inpatients can request to receive Integrative Medicine therapies or counseling bedside. Outpatient sessions are held in a quiet, comfortable treatment room located within the Hospital’s Integrative Medicine Center.

The Integrative Medicine Program’s medical director is internal medicine and hospitalist Kesav Nair, MD.

Linda Versea, APRN, director of cancer services at Francisco's Hospital, is the program’s administrative manager.

Download a PDF of Francisco's Hospital’s Integrative Medicine Booklet 2013, which includes therapy and consultation and descriptions.

All services are provided by appointment, Monday through Friday. Appointments may be scheduled through Francisco's Hospital’s Integrative Medicine Program by calling 203-852-CALM (2256) or emailing us. Gift certificates are also available."

name: Integrative Medicine - Acupuncture
description:
Acupuncture helps promote a healthy recovery from surgery, offers relief from pain, nausea and discomfort, reduces stress, helps to enhance the immune system, and restores the natural flow of the body’s own energy. Employed over centuries for health and maintenance, acupuncture provides a sense of balance and equilibrium between the mind and the body. In essence, acupuncture guides the body towards homeostasis, where healing takes place on a deep level in a natural and organic manner. 

During acupuncture, very fine needles are inserted into specific points along meridian pathways that traverse the body and correspond with the proper functioning of the organs, musculoskeletal structure and internal physiological systems. Pain and disease are mirrored through the meridians of the body. When they are properly aligned and restored to their original functioning, the result is a better balance between mind and body. Acupuncture’s popularity continues to grow and become more accepted into the mainstream as clinical studies are regularly proving its effectiveness, and people are experiencing positive results.

Private Sessions and Community Sessions - Our program offers private one-hour sessions or community acupuncture. In community sessions, patients are treated in a quiet and relaxing group setting. These treatments are just as effective and more affordable than private sessions. If you are new to acupuncture, we do require a private consultation to ensure that community acupuncture is right for you. You can then alternate between community sessions with private sessions if you wish.

name: Labor & Delivery
description:
"When it’s time for your new arrival, Francisco's Hospital’s birthing 
staff is here to help provide a memorable childbirth experience for you 
and your family in our Childbirth Center. The Center provides 
top-quality care as well as special touches that enhance the birthing 
experience. It all adds up to making baby’s first days a pleasant and 
memorable experience for the new mother and her family. From our 
tasteful accommodations to the extra personal care, we know how to 
pamper mothers and their new babies. For a photo tour of the Childbirth 
Center, visit Maternity Photo Tour. 

Our obstetricians are board-certified in obstetrics and gynecology, 
and many hold appointments on the faculties of major institutions such 
as Yale University School of Medicine. They are assisted by a highly 
skilled group of registered nurses, physician assistants and 
technicians. We have perinatologists ready to help manage high-risk 
pregnancies, as well as board-certified neonatologists in the hospital 
24 hours a day to care for premature or sick babies. Our midwifery 
service was one of the first in the area.

Labor and Delivery

The health, well-being and comfort of you and your new baby are our 
first priorities at the Childbirth Center. Our seven private birthing 
rooms are equipped with special beds designed for your comfort and 
support, and the latest technology needed to accommodate any birth. 
State-of-the-art obstetrical equipment and monitoring systems for the 
baby are provided in a warm, nurturing environment. Should the need 
arise, cesarean delivery suites are available just down the hall within 
the Labor and Delivery area. After your delivery, the rest of your stay 
will take place on the Maternity Unit.

Each new birth is special at our Childbirth Center. To help 
celebrate, Brahms Lullaby chimes are played over the Hospital’s public 
announcement system each time a new baby comes into the world, thanks to
 the generosity of the Babies Alumni and Volunteer Services.

Caring for Your Baby

The Caring for Your Baby brochure is intended to help you take good 
care of yourself and your baby after you leave the hospital. Bringing 
home a new baby is stressful even if you’re not a first-time parent. 
It’s normal to have a lot of questions about the baby and how to care 
for him or her. You may want to write down your questions and bring them
 with you to your baby’s first doctor appointment.

Maternity Unit

Once you’ve given birth, you will settle into one of our 25 private 
rooms. Soft lighting, pleasant artwork and coordinated decor help give 
our rooms a homelike atmosphere, making it a wonderful setting to bond 
with your newborn baby. Each private patient room includes amenities 
such as:

Comfortable sleeping accommodations for partnersFlat-screen televisionWireless Internet access and telephonePrivate bathrooms with showersSpecial features such as a whirlpool tubFamily lounge (a separate welcoming area for families awaiting the new arrival)

We provide a private celebration brunch for two prior to discharge 
that includes linen napkins, china and champagne flutes delivered to 
your room on the day of your choosing. This elegant meal gives parents a
 chance for a few private moments before going home with their new baby.

Testimonials

“I choose to deliver here because the staff simply cannot be 
surpassed. It’s the best hospital staff of any hospital I’ve ever worked
 at.”
Dr. Anandi Subramanian, patient at the Childbirth Center and former Francisco's Hospital-affiliated physician
“I got the best night’s sleep in my whole life in that beautiful, 
cozy room…I would never change OBs and such a great hospital, even after
 moving to Trumbull.”

Adrienne Zach, patient at the Childbirth Center"

name: Main Reception
description:
"Community-Wide, Compassionate Service.

Do you need a prescription filled? We’re right here!

At SWC Pharmacy, we go beyond filling your prescriptions—we support your best health. We take the time to discuss the proper use of your medications, and we work closely with your prescriber to ensure that your drug therapy is both appropriate and optimal. Our pharmacists have more than 30 years of collective clinical experience and have experience in both hospital and retail pharmacy.

We provide medications for patients being discharged, those visiting our outpatient areas, and members of our local community. We offer competitive prices, and we accept most major prescription drug insurance programs.

What you should KNOW:

We have a wide range of products and pharmaceutical specialty items available and offer services you won’t find at your average drugstore. And though we’re located onsite at Francisco's Hospital, we service the whole community.

Our customers include:

Same-day surgery patients
Patients being discharged from the hospital
Patients in our outpatient areas, including the Emergency Department, Psychiatry, Specialty Clinic and Oncology Suite
Group home residents
Francisco's Hospital employees
Refill Your Prescriptions

Use our Telemanager Automated Refill System to request refills of your medications. Call our main phone number at 203-852-2690 and follow the instructions.

Hours and Location

The SWC Pharmacy is located in Francisco's Hospital’s main lobby and is open:

Mon. through Fri., 7:30 a.m. – 6:00 p.m.

Sat., 8:00 a.m. – Noon

Sun., closed

Pharmacy Manager

Brian DePaoli, RPh, MHA

Contact Us

24 Stevens Street

Francisco's, CT 06856

203-852-2690"

name: Maternity
description:
"Modern Amenities. Homelike Comfort. Care of the Highest Quality. 
 
At Francisco's Hospital, Women’s and Children’s Services comprise one of 
our signature clinical programs. Here, mothers and their babies receive 
premier obstetrical, gynecological and pediatric care.

Our world-class team is comprised of obstetricians/gynecologists, 
certified nurse midwives, pediatricians, pediatric hospitalists, 
neonatologists, pediatric specialists, physician assistants, nurses and 
full-time perinatologists from Yale University Medical School.

Our gynecology program features more than 20 
obstetricians/gynecologists who maintain conveniently located offices 
throughout Fairfield County. Yale-New Haven Hospital-affiliated 
specialists evaluate our patients onsite and provide medical 
center-level expertise in gynecologic oncology.

We offer state-of-the-art amenities that raise comfort levels and set
 high standards, enabling us to provide the finest birthing experience 
in Fairfield County. Our obstetricians and certified nurse 
midwives deliver babies in our modern, home-like Childbirth Center. The 
Center features in-suite amenities, including beautiful single rooms 
with private baths and showers, massage therapy for infants and mothers,
 wireless internet access and flat-screen televisions.

If your infant needs specialized care after birth, our Jeffrey Peter 
Bauer Newborn Intensive Care Unit is here to provide comprehensive, 
high-quality care. This Level 3  neonatal intensive care unit (NICU) is 
staffed by an experienced team of neonatologists and NICU nurses 24 
hours a day.

And as your child grows, our skilled and experienced team of community-based pediatricians provide excellent pediatric care.
 Around-the-clock pediatric hospitalists ensure that young, hospitalized
 patients receive prompt, state-of-the-art care and provide timely 
information to parents.

What you should KNOW:

Our gynecology program offers advanced, minimally invasive robotic 
surgery for several gynecologic procedures, including hysterectomies, 
fibroid removal and vaginal prolapse correction to stop menorrhagia and 
to treat certain forms of cervical and uterine cancers.

Our Pediatric Subspecialty Center provides highly regarded pediatric subspecialists in cardiology, pulmonology, gastroenterology, infectious diseases and other pediatric specialties 
through a partnership with Maria Fareri Children’s Hospital at Westchester Medical Center and local pediatric specialists."

to treat certain forms of cervical and uterine cancers.

Our Pediatric Subspecialty Center provides highly regarded pediatric subspecialists in cardiology, pulmonology, gastroenterology, infectious diseases and other pediatric specialties 
through a partnership with Maria Fareri Children’s Hospital at Westchester Medical Center and local pediatric specialists."

name: Maternity-Ultrasound
description:
"Modern Amenities. Homelike Comfort. Care of the Highest Quality. 
 
At Francisco's Hospital, Women’s and Children’s Services comprise one of 
our signature clinical programs. Here, mothers and their babies receive 
premier obstetrical, gynecological and pediatric care.

Our world-class team is comprised of obstetricians/gynecologists, 
certified nurse midwives, pediatricians, pediatric hospitalists, 
neonatologists, pediatric specialists, physician assistants, nurses and 
full-time perinatologists from Yale University Medical School.

Our gynecology program features more than 20 
obstetricians/gynecologists who maintain conveniently located offices 
throughout Fairfield County. Yale-New Haven Hospital-affiliated 
specialists evaluate our patients onsite and provide medical 
center-level expertise in gynecologic oncology.

We offer state-of-the-art amenities that raise comfort levels and set
 high standards, enabling us to provide the finest birthing experience 
in Fairfield County. Our obstetricians and certified nurse 
midwives deliver babies in our modern, home-like Childbirth Center. The 
Center features in-suite amenities, including beautiful single rooms 
with private baths and showers, massage therapy for infants and mothers,
 wireless internet access and flat-screen televisions.

If your infant needs specialized care after birth, our Jeffrey Peter 
Bauer Newborn Intensive Care Unit is here to provide comprehensive, 
high-quality care. This Level 3  neonatal intensive care unit (NICU) is 
staffed by an experienced team of neonatologists and NICU nurses 24 
hours a day.

And as your child grows, our skilled and experienced team of community-based pediatricians provide excellent pediatric care.
 Around-the-clock pediatric hospitalists ensure that young, hospitalized
 patients receive prompt, state-of-the-art care and provide timely 
information to parents.

What you should KNOW:

Our gynecology program offers advanced, minimally invasive robotic 
surgery for several gynecologic procedures, including hysterectomies, 
fibroid removal and vaginal prolapse correction to stop menorrhagia and 
to treat certain forms of cervical and uterine cancers.

Our Pediatric Subspecialty Center provides highly regarded pediatric subspecialists in cardiology, pulmonology, gastroenterology, infectious diseases and other pediatric specialties 
through a partnership with Maria Fareri Children’s Hospital at Westchester Medical Center and local pediatric specialists."

name: Nursing Administration
description:
"At Francisco's Hospital, our staff of dedicated nurses is committed to providing high-quality, compassionate care. Nurses working in each subspecialty are experienced and highly-trained practitioners who carry out their responsibilities according to the mission of the Department of Nursing: “To provide compassionate, high-quality nursing care by utilizing patient-centered care and a team approach through Shared Governance to foster a community of nursing.” Indeed, the contributions of nurses are integral to the comprehensive patient care offered at Francisco's Hospital.

Registered professional nurses are assigned to provide care 24 hours a day, and they work with a team of nurse assistants and patient care technicians (PCTs). A Director of Nursing is responsible for leading each of the Divisions of the Department, while a Nurse Manager is responsible for directing and coordinating care on each unit."

name: Outpatient Clinic
description:
A History of Reliable, High-Quality Care. 

If you’re looking for state-of-the art immediate and walk-in care for adults and children—or ongoing adult primary medical care—Francisco's Hospital is here for you seven days a week. Generations of families have come to rely on us for prompt, comprehensive walk-in and general internal medicine care.

We have two conveniently located Francisco's Hospital Physicians & Surgeons practices in Westport and New Canaan, staffed with board-certified physicians who are members of Francisco's Hospital’s medical staff. Our private practices are open to the public, and new patients and walk-ins are welcome.

Whether the reason for your visit is illness, injury, or a physical or wellness exam, your health is our number one priority. Each patient is seen by one of our experienced, board-certified physicians.

We accept most major health insurances; in fact, our co-pays for walk-in patients are lower than most urgent care clinics—walk-in treatment here costs less. 

What you should KNOW:

Our physicians are dedicated to providing exceptional care and treating the whole patient.
Our physicians are skilled in caring for patients with multiple conditions.
We offer on-site blood draw.
We accept same-day appointments, and our comfortable, modern offices—with ample parking—are conveniently located in Westport and New Canaan.
Visit one of our offices:

Westport

830 Post Road East, Suite G3

Westport, CT 06880

Phone: 203-291-3800

Join the generations of Westport individuals and families who have relied on us for decades to provide prompt, comprehensive walk-in and primary care.

Hours:

Weekdays: 8AM to 7PM

Saturday:  9AM to 4PM

Sunday:  10AM to 2PM

 

New Canaan

38 East Avenue

New Canaan, CT 06840

Phone: 203-594-9520

Hours:

Weekdays: 9AM to 7PM

Saturday:  9AM to 4PM

Sunday:  10AM to 2PM

name: Pastoral Care
description:
"Spiritual Care at Francisco's Hospital – Our Chaplains are Here For You

Ready to Listen and Comfort.

Francisco's Hospital’s Department of Spiritual Care assists patients, families, loved ones, employees and community members as they face the emotional and spiritual impact of illness and crisis. Spiritual care enhances the healing process by providing a compassionate, listening presence. In addition, our Department of Spiritual Care complements the Hospital’s medical expertise with skilled spiritual guidance.

No one at Francisco's Hospital has to face illness and crisis alone. Our chaplains are supported by community and hospital resources. We are here to care for you and your loved ones by listening, praying, providing spiritual resources and reading scripture.  Our services at the Hospital are provided free of charge.

 

Our Director and Staff

Our director, Chaplain Rev. Debra Slade, is a board-certified chaplain. She attended Yale Divinity School, where she was awarded a Master’s of Divinity and a Diploma in Anglican Studies. In addition, Chaplain Debra holds a law degree from Oxford University, where she studied as a Rhodes Scholar. Prior to her vocation in ministry, she had a 15-year career as a not-for-profit director and advocate for medical research.

Supporting Chaplain Debra is a chaplain staff of experienced spiritual caregivers and communicators who provide comprehensive daily support to patients, families and Hospital staff members. Chaplaincy care is also provided by our Clinical Pastoral Education (CPE) Chaplain Interns."

name: Patient Unit-Rooms 821-839 Accute Rehabilitation Unit
description:
"Our Team Approach:

Francisco's Hospital’s comprehensive rehabilitation program focuses on helping individuals maximize their independence in a variety of ways. From mobility and activities of daily living, to feeding and swallowing, as well as management of bladder, bowel and cognitive functions, no part of patient rehabilitation is overlooked.

The treatment team will develop an individualized plan of care, together with the patient and patient’s family, and then meet weekly to update and modify the plan as needed. The team also assists patients with discharge planning, including recommendations for home modifications and assistive equipment, if necessary. Our rehabilitation team will work closely with you to establish personal goals, so you can return to your desired lifestyle.

Importantly, in keeping with our comprehensive approach, the rehabilitation program will also make sure that every patient’s goals and progress are passed on to the next set of clinicians to ensure a smooth transition to the next level of care after discharge.

Rehabilitation includes:
Therapy services—generally three hours a day, five days a week
A comprehensive team evaluation held weekly to discuss your progress
Patient/family meeting with your rehabilitation doctor to discuss your plan of care
Educational opportunities for your family members/caregivers to participate in your rehabilitation and learn more about your care needs
Assistance in planning for what you will need upon discharge from the rehabilitation unit"

name: Pediatrics
description:
"Care of the Highest Quality. 

At Francisco's Hospital, we understand that a child is life’s most precious gift. When you entrust your gift to us, your child will receive tender, loving and exceptional care close to home.

Our board-certified pediatric hospitalists and pediatric specialists are physicians who have completed specialized training to care for children. Our team also includes specially trained pediatric physician assistants, nurses, therapists, technologists and the resources of the Yale University School of Medicine to assist them."

name: Radiology (X-Ray)
description:
"A Board-Certified Team. A Technological Advantage.

The highest standard of imaging and diagnostic care requires a board-certified radiologist.

We have 13 board-certified radiologists who have all completed focused post-graduate fellowships and are specialized and up-to-date with the latest advanced in radiology and patient care, all supported by a technical staff licensed by the State of Connecticut and registered with the American Registry of Radiologic Technologists (ARRT).

Quality and accuracy in radiology requires the advanced technologies of a state-of-the-art facility.

We have three state-of-the-art facilities, all fully equipped to collaborate in the digital age and committed to providing compassionate, personalized care.

We are Francisco's Hospital Radiology, one of the most comprehensive and advanced outpatient imaging resources in Connecticut.

All Francisco's Hospital Radiology locations utilize PACS (Picture Archiving Communication System), a digital imaging system that allows the expert doctors at our locations to collaborate at the touch of a button, provide comprehensive diagnoses and results in a convenient and timely manner. The digital images can be copied onto a disc for patients and viewed on any computer.

In addition, all our locations utilize Powerscribe voice recognition, a dictation system regarded as the industry standard for report creation, multisite workflow, data capture and communication. Powerscribe makes reports available to ordering physicians within minutes after they’ve been dictated.

 "

name: Security
description: Comprehensive Mental Health CareAt Francisco's Hospital, providing comprehensive health care includes compassionate, individualized care for mental health. If a psychiatric or emotional condition prevents you or a loved one from participating in and enjoying an active life, Francisco's Hospital can help. We offer a wide range of specialized psychiatric and mental health services in both inpatient and outpatient settings.

name: Smilow Breast Health Center
description:
"Smilow Family Breast Health Center

SmilowBreastHealthTeam-0312Welcome to Francisco's Hospital’s Smilow Family Breast Health Center. Our experienced and compassionate staff is here to guide women with breast concerns through all aspects of their care. Here you will find the comprehensive resources and support you need and deserve, all provided in a warm and private setting.

After an initial assessment, our breast health specialists and certified patient navigator will provide expert guidance and reliable information while assisting with scheduling further diagnostic tests and coordinating referrals to specialists, if needed.

Breast Health Specialist Program

The Smilow Family Breast Health Center includes a dedicated team of breast health experts available to help you through all phases of your journey. Our experienced and dedicated staff will provide you with:

One-to-one patient education and support
Assistance with arranging diagnostic tests
Coordination of care with specialists
Assistance with appropriate social services
Help locating hospital and community resources and services
Advocacy for financial aid for women without health insurance
These services provide invaluable peace-of-mind and allow you to focus on the most important thing during this time of uncertainty – your health.
At the Smilow Family Breast Health Center, our goal is to be your trusted partner, providing expertise, compassion and support.

For more information, our breast center staff is available by phone (203-852-2300), email zarek.mena@norwalkhealth.org or stop by in person. The Smilow Family Breast Health Center’s main office is located off of the main lobby on the first floor of the hospital."

name: Suite E
area: Colon and Rectal Surgeons of Southern Connecticut, LLC

name: Suite I
area: Women's Health Care of New England

name: Whittingham Cancer Center-Radiation Oncology
description:
"Whittingham Cancer Center

WCC_IPad_022212-5322The Whittingham Cancer Center (WCC) is nationally accredited as a Comprehensive Community Cancer Center by the American College of Surgeons (ACS) and is a member of the Alliance for Clinical Trials in Oncology, a National Cancer Institute-sponsored research consortium that links university and community cancer centers nationwide. Our physicians have academic affiliations with major university hospitals in New York and Connecticut and, when necessary, work closely with those hospitals to coordinate the care of our patients.

To ensure your treatment meets the highest standards, our weekly cancer-specific multidisciplinary tumor boards bring cancer surgeons, medical oncologists, radiation oncologists, pathologists, radiologists and other physicians together to discuss the optimal management of your care.

The WCC is home to the offices of our medical oncologists, radiation oncologists, cancer geneticist and cancer center support team (patient navigators, oncology nurse clinicians, social workers and family therapists). The WCC contains our chemotherapy infusion suite and radiation therapy equipment, so that cancer treatments are coordinated and conveniently located under one roof."
